intro: Hieracium semipendulum, commonly known as the hanging hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in meadows, woodlands, and disturbed soils, preferring moist and sunny conditions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Hieracium semipendulum is often found in open habitats and can thrive in a variety of soil types.
